alert.note: Alert for Bienville; Bossier; Caddo; Red River; Webster (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 24 at 10:30PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHERN WEBSTER...NORTHWESTERN RED RIVER...SOUTHEASTERN CADDO...WEST CENTRAL BIENVILLE AND SOUTHEASTERN BOSSIER PARISHES THROUGH 1100 PM CDT... At 1028 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Haughton, or 10 miles southeast of Bossier City, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Shreveport, Bossier City, Haughton, Ringgold, Sibley, Doyline, Heflin, Eastwood, Fosters, Curtis, Fillmore, Bodcau, Plum Orchard Landing, Koran, Ninock, Noles Landing, Lake Bistineau North, Mc Dade, Ogden, and Princeton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Bienville; Bossier; Caddo; Red River; Webster
